benchmark_details.name: TYPYBENCH
benchmark_details.overview: TYPYBENCH is a benchmark designed to evaluate LLMsâ€™ type inference across entire Python repositories. It introduces two novel metrics: TYPESIM, which captures nuanced semantic relationships between predicted and ground truth types, and TYPECHECK, which assesses type consistency across codebases.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized evaluation framework for assessing the type inference capabilities of LLMs in Python repositories.

data.source: Curated dataset of 50 high-quality Python repositories from GitHub and PyPI.
data.annotation: Manual cleaning and preparation of repositories with type information removed.

methods: Benchmarking with TYPESIM and TYPECHECK metrics
methodology.calculation: TYPESIM measures functional similarity between predicted and human-annotated types using structural relationships. TYPECHECK uses mypy to assess type consistency across codebases.
methodology.interpretation: Higher TYPESIM indicates better semantic similarity, while lower TYPECHECK errors suggest better consistency.
methodology.validation: Empirical studies comparing performance across state-of-the-art LLMs.
